alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Delta; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Luce; Marquette; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 4:20AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...PROLONGED WINTRY MIXED PRECIPITATION EVENT TODAY INTO THURSDAY... ...WINTRY MIX TRANSITIONS TO WET SNOW LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY... A prolonged period of wintry mixed precipitation slowly spreads from west to east across Upper Michigan today through Thursday. Precipitation will develop this morning from far western Upper Michigan, around Ironwood, east to Iron Mountain, Escanaba and Menominee, and will remain in that area through the afternoon. The precipitation will begin as a mix of snow, rain and possibly some freezing rain, but will change to mostly rain by afternoon. If traveling across far western into south central Upper Michigan this morning, be aware that some icy spots may develop this morning when the precipitation begins. Slow down and use caution. A wintry mix of rain, snow, and freezing rain then develops late tonight and persists into Wednesday morning. Up to one-quarter inch of ice accretion and 3 inches of wet snow are possible by Wednesday morning, mainly across the Keweenaw and central Upper Michigan. Wet snow becomes widespread and may be heavy at times on Wednesday. Snow shifts east and gradually wanes Wednesday night with snow showers lingering into Thursday near the Lake Superior shoreline.
